main event: A radar observation of a silver, circular UFO was reported over Greenwood Lake, New York, observed on July 7, 1956.
interesting points: The UFO was described as silver and circular, about the size of a dime., It displayed high-speed maneuvers, including hovering and curving upward and downward., The duration of the observation was approximately 15 minutes., The report indicated the need for further investigation to rule out a hoax., This sighting is categorized as having insufficient information for a comprehensive analysis.
witness description: identified civilian who observed the UFO
